Universal hoped the limited release would capitalize on good word-of-mouth support from "serious movie fans" rather than those in the 18–25-year-old [[demographic profile|demographic]].<ref name="horn"/> The film was released across North America on October 31, 2008, playing at 1,850 theaters,<ref name="wide"/> expanding to 1,896 theaters by its fourth week.<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117995955.html|title='Quantum' posts Bond's best opening|author=Pamela McClintock|journal=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=November 16, 2008|accessdate=November 25, 2008}}</ref> ''Changeling'' was released in the United Kingdom on November 26, 2008,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/7734948.stm|title=Jolie's tears for her late mother|author=Staff|work=[[BBC News Online]]|date=November 18, 2008|accessdate=March 3, 2009}}</ref> in Ireland on November 28, 2008,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.rte.ie/ten/2008/1007/eastwood_jolie_palin.html|author=Staff|title=Eastwood jokes about VP offer|work=rte.ie|publisher=[[Raidió Teilifís Éireann|Radio Telefís Éireann]]|date=October 7, 2008|accessdate=October 27, 2008}}</ref> and in Australia on February 5, 2009.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.theage.com.au/news/entertainment/film/modern-morality-tales/2008/12/23/1229998532682.html|title=Modern morality tales|author=Jim Schembri|work=[[The Age]]|publisher=[[Fairfax Media]]|date=December 24, 2008|accessdate=December 24, 2008}}</ref>
===Box office=== [[File:Cinema projecting differents movies in Edinburgh.jpg|thumb|200px|right|alt=|The Cameo Cinema in [[Edinburgh]] screening the film]] ''Changeling'' performed modestly at the box office,<ref>{{cite news|author=Geoffrey Macnab|url=http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/features/julia-roberts--has-cinemas-queen-lost-her-crown-1643714.html|title=Julia Roberts - Has cinema's queen lost her crown?|work=[[The Independent]]|date=March 13, 2009|accessdate=April 3, 2009}}</ref> grossing more internationally than in North America.<ref>{{cite journal|author=Pamela McClintock|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118001196.html|title='Watchmen' battle superhero bias|journal=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=March 13, 2009|accessdate=March 26, 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|author=Pamela McClintock|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118001053.html|title=Clint mints overseas box office|journal=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=March 10, 2009|accessdate=March 26, 2009}}</ref> The worldwide gross revenue was $113 million.<ref name="mojo">{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=changeling08.htm|title=Changeling (2008)|work=[[Box Office Mojo]]|publisher=[[Amazon.com]]|accessdate=June 5, 2009}}</ref> The film's limited American release saw it take $502,000—$33,441 per theater—in its first two days.<ref name="limited"/> Exit polling showed strong commercial potential across a range of audiences.<ref name="finke"/> [[CinemaScore]] polls conducted during the opening weekend revealed the average grade cinemagoers gave ''Changeling'' was A− on an A+ to F scale.<ref>{{cite journal|author=Joshua Rich|title='High School Musical 3' Scares up Another Win|url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20237423,00.html|journal=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=November 2, 2008|accessdate=November 2, 2008}}</ref> Audiences were mostly older; 68% were over 30 and 61% were women.<ref name="var-weekend">{{cite journal|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117995130.html|title='School' still rules box office|author=Pamela McClintock|journal=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=November 2, 2008|accessdate=November 3, 2008}}</ref> Audience evaluations of "excellent" and "definitely recommended" were above average. The main reasons given for seeing the film were its story (65%), Jolie (53%), Eastwood (43%), and that it was based on fact (42%).<ref name="finke"/> The film made $2.3M in its first day of wide release,<ref name="wide">{{cite journal|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117995123.html|title='Saw V' scares off B.O. competition|journal=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|author=Anthony D'Alessandro|date=November 1, 2008|accessdate=November 1, 2008}}</ref> going on to take fourth place in the weekend box office chart with $9.4M—a per-theater average of $5,085.<ref name="var-weekend"/> This return surpassed Universal's expectations for the weekend.<ref name="finke">{{cite web|url=http://www.deadline.com/2008/11/box-office-report-coming/|title=Halloween Scared Weekend Filmgoers|author=[[Nikki Finke]]|work=Deadline Hollywood Daily|date=November 1, 2008|accessdate=November 25, 2008}}</ref> ''Changeling''{{'}}s link to the [[Inland Empire (California)|Inland Empire]]—the locale of the Wineville killings—generated additional local interest, causing it to outperform the national box office by 45% in its opening weekend.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.pe.com/localnews/inland/stories/PE_News_Local_S_boxoffice04.37cb1b6.html|title=Local ties help make 'Changeling' an Inland box-office hit|author=Fielding Buck|work=[[The Press-Enterprise (California)|The Press-Enterprise]]|publisher=[[A. H. Belo Corporation]]|date=November 3, 2008|accessdate=November 4, 2008}}{{dead link|date=September 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref><ref group="Note">''Changeling'' took $117,862 in 16 Inland Empire theaters, for an average of $7,366 per location.</ref> The film surpassed expectations in its second weekend of wide release,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.the-numbers.com/interactive/newsStory.php?newsID=3817|title=Box Office Goes Wild|author=Staff|work=The Numbers|publisher=Nash Information Services|date=November 11, 2008|accessdate=December 22, 2008}}</ref> declining 22% to take $7.3M.<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117995549.html|title=Audiences wild about 'Madagascar'|author=Pamela McClintock|journal=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=November 9, 2008|accessdate=November 25, 2008}}</ref> By the fourth week, ''Changeling'' had dropped to fifth place at the box office, having taken $27.6M overall.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.the-numbers.com/interactive/newsStory.php?newsID=3830|title=Nothing Small About Quantum|author=Staff|work=The Numbers|publisher=Nash Information Services|date=November 18, 2008|accessdate=December 22, 2008}}</ref> In its sixth week the number of theaters narrowed to 1,010,<ref name="numbers">{{cite web|url=http://www.the-numbers.com/movies/2008/CHNGL.php|title=The Changeling|work=The Numbers|publisher=Nash Information Services|accessdate=February 11, 2009}}</ref> and ''Changeling'' dropped out of the national top ten, though it remained in ninth place on the Inland chart.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.pe.com/localnews/inland/stories/PE_News_Local_S_boxoffice02.1dcd2e2.html|title=It's very merry at box office for 'Four Christmases'|author=Fielding Buck|work=[[The Press-Enterprise (California)|The Press-Enterprise]]|publisher=[[A. H. Belo Corporation]]|date=December 1, 2008|accessdate=December 22, 2008}}{{dead link|date=September 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref><ref group="Note">In the film's sixth week of release in the Inland Empire, it earned $20,540 on 14 screens.</ref> ''Changeling'' completed its theatrical run in North America on January 8, 2009, having earned $35.7M overall.<ref name="mojo"/>
''Changeling'' made its international debut in four European markets on November 12–14, 2008,<ref name="int"/> opening in 727 theaters to strong results.<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117995954.html|title='Solace' continues world domination|author=Dave McNary|journal=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=December 16, 2008|accessdate=November 25, 2008}}</ref> Aided by a positive critical reaction, the film took $1.6M in Italy from 299 theaters (a per-location average of $5,402),<ref name="europe">{{cite journal|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117996322.html|title='Burn After Reading' on fire overseas|author=Pamela McClintock, Archie Thomas|journal=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=November 21, 2008|accessdate=November 25, 2008}}</ref> and $209,000 from 33 screens in Belgium.<ref name="school">{{cite news|url=http://www.the-numbers.com/interactive/newsStory.php?newsID=3844|title=School Climbing Higher|author=Staff|work=The Numbers|publisher=Nash Information Services|date=November 23, 2008|accessdate=December 23, 2008}}</ref> ''Changeling'' had a slower start in France, but improved to post $2.8M from 417 theaters in its first five days,<ref name="europe"/> and finished the weekend in second place at the box office.<ref name="school"/> The second week in France saw the box office drop by just 27%, for a total gross of $5.4M.<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117996452.html|title=Bond still boss in Europe|author=Archie Thomas|journal=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=November 25, 2008|accessdate=December 23, 2008}}</ref> By November 23, 2008, the film had taken $8.6M outside North America.<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/solace-still-going-strong-overseas-123422|title='Solace' still going strong overseas|author=Frank Segers|journal=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=November 23, 2008|accessdate=November 25, 2008}} (registration required for online access)</ref> The weekend of November 28–30 saw ''Changeling'' take $4.4M from 1,040 theaters internationally;<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117996589.html|title='Quantum' still rules overseas|author=Dave McNary|journal=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=November 30, 2008|accessdate=December 23, 2008}}</ref> this included its expansion into the United Kingdom, where it opened in third place at the box office, taking $1.9M from 349 theaters.<ref name="segers">{{cite journal|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/quantum-takes-intl-bo-fifth-123636|title='Quantum' takes int'l b.o. for fifth week|author=Frank Segers|journal=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=November 30, 2008|accessdate=November 30, 2008}} (registration required for online access)</ref> It took $1.5M from the three-day weekend, but the total was boosted by the film's opening two days earlier to avoid competition from previews of ''[[Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa]]''.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/film/filmblog/2008/dec/02/uk-box-office|title=Santa smashes Bond for UK box-office crown|author=Charles Gant|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=December 2, 2008|accessdate=December 2, 2008}}</ref> The return marked the best opening of any Eastwood-directed film in the United Kingdom to that point.<ref name="segers"/> Its second week of release in the United Kingdom saw a drop of 27% to $1.1M.<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117997076.html|title='Escape 2 Africa' heats up Europe|author=Archie Thomas|journal=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=December 9, 2008|accessdate=December 23, 2008}}</ref> ''Changeling'' earned $7.6M in Ireland and the United Kingdom.<ref name="int"/>
''Changeling''{{'}}s release in other European markets continued throughout {{Nowrap|December 2008}}.<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117996868.html|title='Punisher' to hit box office zone|author=Ben Fritz, Dave McNary|journal=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=December 4, 2008|accessdate=December 23, 2008}}</ref><ref name="hy">{{cite journal|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/madagascar-sequel-marks-territory-124064|title=Madagascar' sequel marks its territory|author=[[Hy Hollinger]]|journal=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=December 8, 2008|accessdate=December 23, 2008}} (registration required for online access)</ref> By December 8, the film had opened in 1,167 theaters in nine markets for an international gross of $19.1M.<ref name="hy"/><ref name="enthralling">{{cite news|url=http://www.the-numbers.com/interactive/newsStory.php?newsID=3891|title=International Releases are Enthralling|author=Staff|work=The Numbers|publisher=Nash Information Services|date=December 14, 2008|accessdate=December 23, 2008}}</ref> ''Changeling''{{'}}s next significant international release came in Spain on December 19, 2008,<ref name="enthralling"/> where it opened in first place at the box office with $2.0M from 326 theaters. This figure marked the best opening for an Eastwood-directed film in the country to that point;<ref name="screen1">{{cite news|url=http://www.screendaily.com/ScreenDailyArticle.aspx?intStoryID=42458|title=Madagascar 2 soars past $200m after $33.5m weekend for PPI|author=Jeremy Kay|work=[[Screen International|Screen Daily]]|publisher=[[EMAP|East Midland Allied Press]]|date=December 22, 2008|accessdate=December 23, 2008}}</ref> after six weeks it had earned $11.0M. In {{Nowrap|January 2009}}, major markets in which the film opened included Germany, South Korea and Russia. In Germany, it opened in ninth place at the box office with $675,000 from 194 theaters. South Korea saw a "solid" opening of $450,000 from 155 theaters.<ref name="screen2"/> In Russia, it opened in eighth place with $292,000 from 95 theaters.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.the-numbers.com/interactive/newsStory.php?newsID=3981|title=International Details - Escaping the Top Five|author=Staff|work=The Numbers|publisher=Nash Information Services|date=January 25, 2009|accessdate=February 12, 2009}}</ref> By January 26, 2009, the film had taken $47.2M from 1,352 international theaters.<ref name="screen2">{{cite news|url=http://www.screendaily.com/ScreenDailyArticle.aspx?intStoryID=42833|title=Valkyrie leads international box office with $13.2m in 13 markets|author=Jeremy Kay|work=[[Screen International|Screen Daily]]|publisher=[[EMAP|East Midland Allied Press]]|date=January 26, 2009|accessdate=February 12, 2009}}</ref> Aided by strong word-of-mouth support, ''Changeling''{{'}}s Australian release yielded $3.8M from 74 screens after eight weeks.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://blogs.theage.com.au/schembri/archives/2009/03/post_16.html|title='Knowing' hits while 'Two Fists' tanks|author=Jim Schembri|work=[[The Age]]|publisher=[[Fairfax Media]]|date=March 31, 2009|accessdate=April 2, 2009}}</ref> The film opened in Japan on February 20, 2009,<ref name="int"/> where it topped the chart in its first week with $2.4M from 301 screens.<ref name="numbers-conf"/> After six weeks, it had earned $12.8M in the country.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.screendaily.com/ScreenDailyArticle.aspx?intStoryID=43828|title=Summit's Knowing takes international crown with $9.8m from 10 markets|author=Jeremy Kay|work=[[Screen International|Screen Daily]]|publisher=[[EMAP|East Midland Allied Press]]|date=March 29, 2009|accessdate=March 29, 2008}}</ref> The film's last major market release was in Mexico on February 27, 2009,<ref name="numbers-conf">{{cite news|url=http://www.the-numbers.com/interactive/newsStory.php?newsID=4066|title=Confessions of the International Box Office|author=Staff|work=The Numbers|publisher=Nash Information Services|date=March 1, 2009|accessdate=March 4, 2009}}</ref> where it earned $1.4M. The international gross was $77.3M.<ref name="int">{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?page=intl&id=changeling08.htm|title=Changeling (2008) International Box Office Results|work=[[Box Office Mojo]]|publisher=[[Amazon.com]]|accessdate=June 5, 2009}}</ref>
===Home media=== ''Changeling'' was released on [[Blu-ray Disc]], [[DVD]], and [[Video on demand|Video on Demand]] in North America on February 17, 2009,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.highdefdigest.com/news/show/Universal/Disc_Announcements/Universal_to_Bring_Changeling_to_Blu-ray/2330|author=Staff|title=Universal to Bring 'Changeling' to Blu-ray|work=High-Def Digest|publisher=[[Internet Brands]]|date=December 15, 2008|accessdate=December 22, 2008}}</ref><ref name="dvdsales">{{cite web|url=http://www.the-numbers.com/movies/2008/CHNGL-DVD.php|title=The Changeling - DVD Sales|work=The Numbers|publisher=Nash Information Services|accessdate=March 27, 2009}}</ref> and in the United Kingdom on March 30, 2009.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.play.com/DVD/DVD/4-/5830681/Changeling/Product.html|title=Changeling (2008)|work=[[Play.com]]|accessdate=March 4, 2009}}</ref> After its first week of release, ''Changeling'' placed fourth in the DVD sales chart with 281,000 units sold for $4.6 million;<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.the-numbers.com/interactive/newsStory.php?newsID=4072|title=High School Graduates Top of Its Class|author=Staff|work=The Numbers|publisher=Nash Information Services|date=March 3, 2009|accessdate=March 4, 2009}}</ref> by its fourth week of release, the film had dropped out of the top 10, having earned $10.1 million.<ref name="dvdsales"/> As of the latest figures, 762,000 units have been sold, translating to $12,638,223 in revenue.<ref name="dvdsales"/> The DVD release included two [[featurette]]s: ''Partners in Crime: Clint Eastwood and Angelina Jolie'' and ''The Common Thread: Angelina Jolie Becomes Christine Collins''. The Blu-ray Disc release included two additional features: ''Archives'' and ''Los Angeles: Then and Now''.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://bluray.highdefdigest.com/news/show/Universal/Exclusive_HD_Content/Universal_Outlines_Changeling_Blu-ray_Specs,_Exclusives/2380|author=Staff|title=Universal Outlines 'Changeling' Blu-ray Specs, Exclusives|work=High-Def Digest|publisher=[[Internet Brands]]|date=January 7, 2009|accessdate=March 4, 2009}}</ref>
==Reception==
===Critical response=== The film's screening at Cannes met with critical acclaim, prompting speculation it could be awarded the [[Palme d'Or]].<ref name="creative"/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://goldderby.latimes.com/awards_goldderby/2008/05/clint-eastwood.html|title=Clint Eastwood could win the Palme d'Or for his Angelina Jolie pic (whatever the title is)|author=Tom O'Neil|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=May 21, 2008|accessdate=May 21, 2008}}</ref> The award eventually went to ''[[Entre les murs]]'' (''The Class'').<ref>{{cite news|author=Kenneth Turan|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/news/movies/la-et-cannes26-2008may26,0,7548309.story|title=Palme d'Or goes to France's 'Entre les Murs'|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=May 28, 2008|accessdate=October 7, 2008}}</ref> Straczynski claimed that ''Changeling''{{'}}s loss by two votes was due to the judges' not believing the story was based on fact. He said they did not believe the police would treat someone as they had Collins. The loss led to Universal's request that Straczynski annotate the script with sources.<ref name="creative"/> Although the positive critical notices from Cannes generated speculation that the film would be a serious contender at the 2009 Academy Awards, the North American theatrical release met with a more mixed response.<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.variety.com/awardcentral_article/VR1117995793.html|title=Changeling: Eastwood continues success with Jolie drama|journal=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|author=Justin Chang|date=November 14, 2008|accessdate=November 14, 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.variety.com/awardcentral_article/VR1118000050.html|title=Quest for Oscar leaves some films out|journal=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|author=Glenn Whipp|date=February 11, 2009|accessdate=March 30, 2009}}</ref> Critics generally judged ''Changeling'' well-acted and beautifully shot, but considered the compelling story to have been told too conventionally.<ref name="rotten">{{cite web|url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/1191742_changeling/|title=Changeling Movie Reviews|work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|publisher=IGN Entertainment, Inc|accessdate=April 6, 2009}}</ref> [[Metacritic]], which assigns a [[standard score|normalized]] rating out of 100 to reviews from mainstream critics, reported that reviews were "generally favorable," with an [[weighted mean|average]] score of 63 based on 38 reviews.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/film/titles/changeling2008|title=Changeling (2008): Reviews|work=[[Metacritic]]|publisher=CNET Networks, Inc|accessdate=November 27, 2008}}</ref> As of June 10, 2014, 63% of 197 critics listed by review aggregator [[Rotten Tomatoes]] had given the film a positive review, with an average rating of 6.3/10.<ref name="rotten"/> The film's reception in several European countries was more favorable,<ref name="europe"/><ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117997653.html|title=Europe gets in festive mood|author=Nick Vivarelli|journal=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=December 19, 2008|accessdate=December 20, 2008}}</ref> and in the United Kingdom 83% of critics listed by Rotten Tomatoes gave ''Changeling'' a positive review.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/1191742_changeling/news/1783626/uk_critics_consensus_local_critics_warm_to_changeling_de_niro_delights_but_what_just_happened_doesnt|title=UK Critics Consensus: Local Critics Warm To Changeling; De Niro Delights But What Just Happened Doesn't|author=Tom Butler|date=November 28, 2008|work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|publisher=IGN Entertainment, Inc|accessdate=November 29, 2008}}</ref>
{{quote box|width=35%|quote="Jolie puts on a powerful emotional display as a tenacious woman who gathers strength from the forces that oppose her. She reminds us that there is nothing so fierce as a mother protecting her cub."|source=—Kirk Honeycutt of ''The Hollywood Reporter''<ref name="honeycutt"/>}} Todd McCarthy of ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' said Jolie was more affecting than in ''[[A Mighty Heart (film)|A Mighty Heart]]'' (2007) because she relied less on artifice. He also noted a surfeit of good supporting performances, Michael Kelly's in particular.<ref name="mccarthy">{{cite journal|url=http://www.variety.com/index.asp?layout=awardcentral&jump=review&id=film&reviewid=VE1117937210|title='Changeling' review|author=Todd McCarthy|journal=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=May 20, 2008|accessdate=May 21, 2008}}</ref> Oliver Séguret of ''[[Libération]]'' said the cast was the film's best feature. He praised the supporting actors and said Jolie's performance was forceful yet understated.<ref name="liberation">{{cite news|url=http://www.liberation.fr/cinema/010181328-l-echange-bon-procede|title=L'Echange: bon procédé|author=Oliver Séguret|work=[[Libération]]|language=French|date=May 21, 2008|accessdate=February 25, 2009}}</ref> Kirk Honeycutt of ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' said Jolie shunned her "movie star" persona to appear vulnerable and resolute. He perceived the supporting characters—Amy Ryan's excepted—as having few shades of gray.<ref name="honeycutt">{{cite journal|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/changeling-126241|title=Film Review: Changeling|author=Kirk Honeycutt|journal=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=May 20, 2008|accessdate=May 21, 2008}}</ref> David Ansen, writing in ''[[Newsweek]]'', echoed the sentiment, but said that "some stories really are about the good guys and the bad". He said that with the distractions of Jolie's celebrity and beauty put aside, she carried the role with restraint and intensity.<ref name="ansen">{{cite journal|url=http://www.newsweek.com/id/164500|title=The Horror Of It All|author=David Ansen|journal=[[Newsweek]]|date=October 18, 2008|accessdate=October 21, 2008}}</ref> [[Manohla Dargis]] of ''[[The New York Times]]'' felt that Jolie's celebrity was distracting enough to render her unconvincing,<ref name="dargis">{{cite news|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2008/05/21/movies/21dargis.html|title=A California of Noir Shadows and Blood|author=[[Manohla Dargis]]|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=May 21, 2008|accessdate=November 11, 2008}}</ref> and [[David Denby (film critic)|David Denby]] of ''The New Yorker'' said that while Jolie showed skill and selflessness, the performance and character were uninteresting. He said Collins was one-dimensional, lacking desires or temperament. He cited similar problems with Malkovich's Briegleb, concluding, "The two of them make a very proper and dull pair of collaborators."<ref name="denby">{{cite journal|url=http://www.newyorker.com/arts/critics/cinema/2008/10/27/081027crci_cinema_denby?currentPage=all|title=Troubled Sons|author=David Denby|journal=[[The New Yorker]]|date=October 27, 2008|accessdate=October 20, 2008|authorlink=David Denby (film critic)}}</ref>
McCarthy admired the "outstanding" script, calling it ambitious and deceptively simple. He said Eastwood respected the script by not playing to the melodramatic aspects and not telegraphing the story's scope from the start.<ref name="mccarthy"/> Honeycutt wrote that due to its close adherence to the history the drama sagged at one point, but that the film did not feel as long as its 141 minutes because the filmmakers were "good at cutting to the chase".<ref name="honeycutt"/> Ansen said Straczynski's dialogue tended to the obvious, but that while the film lacked the moral nuance of Eastwood's others, the well-researched screenplay was "a model of sturdy architecture", each layer of which built audience disgust into a "fine fury". He said, "when the tale is this gripping, why resist the moral outrage?"<ref name="ansen"/>
{{quote box|width=35%|align=left|quote="J. Michael Straczynski's disjointed script manages to ring false at almost every significant turn ... and Clint Eastwood's ponderous direction—a disheartening departure from his sure touch in {{'}}''Letters From Iwo Jima''{{'}} and {{'}}''The Bridges of Madison County''{{'}}—magnifies the flaws."|source=—[[Joe Morgenstern]], writing for ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]''<ref>{{cite news | url=http://online.wsj.com/article/SB122479914867964509.html | title='Changeling,' Impostor Tale, Itself Feels False | author=[[Joe Morgenstern]] | work=[[The Wall Street Journal]] | date=October 24, 2008 | accessdate=April 4, 2009 }}</ref>}} Séguret said the film presented a solid recreation of the era, but that Eastwood did not seem inspired by the challenge. Séguret noted that Eastwood kept the embers of the story alight, but that it seldom burst into flames. He likened the experience to being in a luxury car: comfortable yet boring.<ref name="liberation"/> Denby and Ansen commented that Eastwood left the worst atrocities to audiences' imaginations. Ansen said this was because Eastwood was less interested in the lurid aspects of the case.<ref name="ansen"/> McCarthy praised the thoughtful, unsensationalized treatment,<ref name="mccarthy"/> while Denby cited problems with the austere approach, saying it left the film "both impressive and monotonous". He said Eastwood was presented with the problem of not wanting to exploit the "gruesome" material because this would contrast poorly with the delicate emotions of a woman's longing for her missing son. Denby said Eastwood and Straczynski should have explored more deeply the story's perverse aspects. Instead, he said, the narrative methodically settled the emotional and dramatic issues—"reverently chronicling Christine's apotheosis"—before "[ambling] on for another forty minutes".<ref name="denby"/> Ansen said the classical approach lifted the story to another level, and that it embraced horror film conventions only in the process of transcending them.<ref name="ansen"/> McCarthy said ''Changeling'' was one of Eastwood's most vividly realized films, noting Stern's cinematography, the set and costume design, and CGI landscapes that merged seamlessly with location shots.<ref name="mccarthy"/> Dargis was not impressed by the production design; she cited the loss of Eastwood's regular collaborator [[Henry Bumstead]]—who died in 2006—as a factor in ''Changeling''{{'}}s "overly pristine" look.<ref name="dargis"/>
Damon Wise of ''[[Empire (magazine)|Empire]]'' called ''Changeling'' "flawless",<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.empireonline.com/features/cannes2008/Post.asp?id=145|title=Clint Eastwood's Changeling Is The Best Of The Festival So Far|author=Damon Wise|journal=[[Empire (magazine)|Empire]]|date=May 20, 2008|accessdate=May 21, 2008}}</ref> and McCarthy said it was "emotionally powerful and stylistically sure-handed". He stated that ''Changeling'' was a more complex and wide-ranging work than Eastwood's ''Mystic River'', saying the characters and social commentary were brought into the story with an "almost breathtaking deliberation". He said that as "a sorrowful critique of the city's political culture", ''Changeling'' sat in the company of films such as ''Chinatown'' and ''[[L.A. Confidential (film)|L.A. Confidential]]''.<ref name="mccarthy"/> Honeycutt said the film added a "forgotten chapter to the L.A. noir" of those films, and that Eastwood's melodic score contributed to an evocation of a city and a period "undergoing galvanic changes". Honeycutt said, "[the] small-town feel to the street and sets ... captures a society resistant to seeing what is really going on".<ref name="honeycutt"/> Séguret said that while ''Changeling'' had few defects, it was mystifying that other critics had such effusive praise for it.<ref name="liberation"/> Denby said it was beautifully made, but that it shared the chief fault of other "righteously indignant" films in congratulating the audience for feeling contempt for the "long-discredited" attitudes depicted.<ref name="denby"/> Ansen concluded that the story was told in such a sure manner that only a hardened cynic would be left unmoved by the "haunting, sorrowful saga".<ref name="ansen"/>
===Awards and honors=== In addition to the following list of awards and nominations, the [[National Board of Review of Motion Pictures]] named ''Changeling'' one of the 10 best films of 2008,<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.variety.com/VR1117996815.html|title=NBR names 'Slumdog' best of year|author=Staff|journal=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=December 4, 2008|accessdate=December 9, 2008}}</ref> as did the [[International Press Academy]], which presents the annual [[Satellite Award]]s.<ref>{{cite journal|author=Gregg Kilday|title=Int'l Press Academy announces nominations|journal=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=November 30, 2008|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/intl-press-academy-announces-nominations-123650|accessdate=December 3, 2008}} (registration required for online access)</ref> Several critics included the film on their lists of the top 10 best films of 2008. [[Anthony Lane]] of ''[[The New Yorker]]'' named it second best, ''[[Empire (magazine)|Empire]]'' magazine named it fourth best, and Rene Rodriguez of ''[[The Miami Herald]]'' named it joint fourth best with Eastwood's ''[[Gran Torino (film)|Gran Torino]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://apps.metacritic.com/film/awards/2008/toptens.shtml|title=Metacritic: 2008 Film Critic Top Ten Lists|work=[[Metacritic]]|publisher=CNET Networks, Inc|accessdate=February 4, 2012}}</ref> Japanese film critic [[Shigehiko Hasumi]] listed the film as one of the best films of 2000-2009.<ref>{{cite book |last1=Aoyama |first1=Shinji |authorlink1=Shinji Aoyama |last2=Hasumi |first2=Shigehiko |authorlink2=Shigehiko Hasumi |last3=Kurosawa |first3=Kiyoshi |authorlink3=Kiyoshi Kurosawa |title=Eiga Nagabanashi |year=2011 |language=Japanese |publisher=Little More |page=271 |isbn=978-4-89815-313-0}}</ref>
